descriptivenote.p: Collection material in English and Hmong.

corpname.part: American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Collection of audio and video field recordings and photographs documenting the Hmong community in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Hmong Community Folklife and Documentation Project collection was processed by Sara Ludewig in April 2023.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Duplication of collection materials may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p:
The Hmong Community Folklife and Documentation Project collection is open to research. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at
https://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact
Certain restrictions to use or copying of materials may apply.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [item, date, container number], Hmong Community Folklife and Documentation Project collection (AFC 2007/026), American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Hmong Community Folklife and Documentation Project was a joint effort of the Folklife Center of International House and the Hmong community in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania from 1981 to 1986. The staff included community coordinator Chao Song, project director Carole Boughter, media coordinator Barry Dornfeld, Ellen McHale, Mal O'Connor, Sally Peterson, Margaret A. Mills, Yer Hang, Bee Lo, Moua Lo, Phua Xiong, Hang Sai, Chakarin Sirirathasuk, and Mai Vang Xiong. The project was funded by the National Endowment for the Arts Folk Arts Program, the Pennsylvania Council for the Arts, CIGNA Foundation, and the Sun Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
The collection contains audio and video field recordings and photographs documenting the Hmong community in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, between 1981 to 1986. Documentation covers daily life; community celebrations including Hmong New Year celebrations, baby naming ceremonies, and weddings; and traditional arts like paj ntaub needlework, Hmong instruments, music, and dance. Interviews with community members were conducted in Hmong and some have English summaries. Also included in the collection are brochures, an index to the interviews, completed recording log forms, photo logs, and copies of a documentary titled
Years Away from Laos: The Hmong in Philadelphia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Hmong Community Folklife and Documentation Project collection is organized in 6 series:

item.ref:
Series 5:
Years Away from Laos: The Hmong in Philadelphia
documentary project

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged chronologically within each series.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.
